alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Ellis; Hunt; Kaufman; Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 27 at 9:39PM CDT until October 27 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Dallas County in north central Texas... Northeastern Ellis County in north central Texas... Southwestern Hunt County in north central Texas... Central Kaufman County in north central Texas... Eastern Rockwall County in north central Texas... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 939 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across portions of Ellis and Kaufman County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Hill, Rockwall, Lancaster, Waxahachie, Ennis, Midlothian, Terrell, Seagoville, Forney, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Kaufman, Royse City, Fate, Wilmer, Ovilla, Crandall, Ferris, Palmer and Combine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
